009package Ch04_Filters;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
013import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
014
015/**
016 * <p>
017 * ImageJ plugin for a linear 3Ã—3 "box" filter. 
018 * First a duplicate (copy) of the original image (orig) is created,
019 * which is used as the source image in the subsequent filter computation. 
020 * The resulting value q is placed in the original image. Notice that the
021 * border pixels remain unchanged because they are not reached by the iteration
022 * over (u,v).
023 * See Sec. 4.2 (Prog. 4.1) of [1] for additional details.
024 * </p>
025 * <p>
026 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic
027 * Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
028 * </p>
029 * 
030 * @author WB
031 *
032 */
033public class Filter_Box_3x3 implements PlugInFilter {
034
035    public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus imp) {
036        return DOES_8G;
037    }
038
039    public void run(ImageProcessor orig) {
040        final int M = orig.getWidth();
041        final int N = orig.getHeight();
042        final double W = 9;
043        ImageProcessor copy = orig.duplicate();
044
045                for (int u = 1; u <= M - 2; u++) {
046                        for (int v = 1; v <= N - 2; v++) {
047                //compute filter result for position (u, v):
048                int sum = 0;
049                for (int i = -1; i <= 1; i++) {
050                        for (int j = -1; j <= 1; j++) {
051                                                int p = copy.getPixel(u + i, v + j);
052                        sum = sum + p;
053                    }
054                }
055                int q = (int) (sum / W);
056                                orig.putPixel(u, v, q);
057            }
058        }
059    }
060
061}
